Title: Optometrist
Description:
Optometrist (Statewide)
$88,464 - $117,288 Full Time
$44,232 - $58,644 Part Time
Do you love being an optometrist, but ready to ditch the never-ending insurance paperwork and inconvenient retail schedules? If so, consider a full or part time position with California Correctional Health Care Services (CCHCS). Here, you’ll find multidisciplinary clinical teams, excellent State of California benefits, and a positive work-life balance. Plus, with locations throughout California, you’re sure to find your perfect fit!
Key Responsibilities
· Provide comprehensive eye examinations, utilizing retinoscope, ophthalmometer, Snellen chart, and other aids
· Correct defects through the use of lenses, prisms, or eye exercises without the application of medical or surgical techniques
· Prescribe, fit, and repair glasses
· Instruct ancillary medical staff in techniques and methods
Minimum Qualifications
· Two years’ experience in the practice of optometry with current CA licensure in optometry
Benefits
· Generous paid time off and holiday schedule
· State of California retirement that vests in 5 years – visit www.CalPERS.ca.gov for retirement formulas
· Robust 401(k) and 457(b) retirement plans (tax defer up to $45,000 - $60,000 per year)
· Wide Variety of Geographic Settings including the Northern California Coast, San Francisco Bay Area, California Capitol, and Southern California
· And much more
About Us
California Correctional Health Care Services (CCHCS) is dedicated to enhancing public safety and promoting successful community reintegration through education, treatment, and active participation in rehabilitative and restorative justice programs. Our mission is to facilitate the successful reintegration of individuals in our care back into their communities, equipped with the tools to be drug-free, healthy, and employable members of society.
To apply and learn more about these opportunities, please visit: https://calcareers.ca.gov/CalHRPublic/Search/JobSearchResults.aspx#kw=Optometrist&depid=279
EOE

Title: Design Assistant
Location:
San Francisco, CA 94103 
(South of Market area)
Description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
The primary role of Design Assistant is to assist the designers during the design process by gathering required design materials for projects including:
· Furniture options, fabric samples, accessories, lead time, pricing
· Building materials, finishes, appliances, plumbing, hardware and bath accessories
· Paint and finish options, preliminary color schemes
· Sketches for custom furniture, pillows, accessories
· Compose mood boards, gather relevant images
· Draft elevations, floor plans and render presentation drawings
Organize and maintain design library:
· Set up meetings with vendors and present new materials to project team
· Maintain the library, return samples to design center
· Collect relevant images from magazines and books
· Research new products, materials and finishes
Prepare for client meetings and other responsibilities as needed:
· Gather and pack necessary materials and organize the meeting agenda
· Write and revise specifications, proposals and purchase orders for furnishings and accessories
· Create budgets, schedules and specifications
· Type meeting notes, create project binders
· Responsible for organization of project folder and ensure filing system
· Assist Interns
· Partner with the design team to develop designs, concepts, schematics, and specifications for residential, hospitality and commercial projects/properties.
· Prepare and complete contract documents to meet client program, company standards, and project budget constraints including but not limited to: design presentations, moodboards, materials palettes, construction drawing sets, rendered floorplans and elevations (2D and 3D visualizations), specifications package, FF&E selections, custom furniture design and documentation, finishes package
REQUIREMENTS:
· Degree in Interior Design and/or Architecture from an accredited 4 year+ program
· Minimum of 1–3 years of work experience in the industry
· Excellent presentation skills including space planning and drawing
· Proficiency in AutoCAD, Adobe InDesign and Photoshop, Sketchup, Microsoft Office Suite (Experience in Studio Designer, Specsources, Bluebeam, Revit, 3DSMax is a plus)
· Experience selecting and specifying lighting, furnishings, hardware, floor/window coverings, materials, and finishes; while managing vendor relations
· Must be able to create construction documents, section details, presentation boards, 2D/3D renderings
· Experience with quotes, proposals, budgets, purchase orders and purchasing process
· Experience in the production of specification deliverables
· Must have strong presentation and public speaking skills
· Must be able to work independently, as well as, interact effectively with the design team on multiple projects.
· Must have strong knowledge of trade resources, vendors, and industry standards
CORE COMPETENCIES:
· Task Focus: Delivers legendary service to clients and vendors that meets and exceeds expectations
· Ethics & Integrity: Adheres to company values, beliefs, and principles of innovation and excellence in design
· Composure: Remains calm, maintains perspective, and responds in a professional manner when faced with tough situations
· Personal Learning: Takes personal responsibility for the continuous learning of new knowledge, skills, and experiences
· Dealing with Ambiguity: Able to successfully function during times of uncertainty and changing priorities
· Decision-Making: Makes keen, timely decisions based on a mixture of analysis, wisdom, experience and judgment
· Interpersonal Savvy: Builds effective relationships with all people—up, down and sideways, inside and outside of the company
· Results Oriented: Gets results and achieves goals
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS OF THE POSITION:
· This position will be working in a typical office setting, with no extremes in temperature or lighting
· Able to occasionally travel and present at offsite locations in the Bay Area
· Applicants should be able to work with equipment typically found in an office and should be able to perform the essential functions of the job, with or without accommodation. Possible accommodations needed should be discussed prior to the onset of employment and/or the interview process
· Ability to lift 25lbs and transport items in and out of vehicles. Ability to work on feet/run errands for 4+ hours per day as needed. Ability to sit at a desk for 6+ hours per day

Title: Express Lanes Operations Operator
Description:
The Express Lanes Operator will support the Express Lanes operation in the monitoring and management of Express Lanes tolling in the Bay Area.
What you will be doing:
Respond to, communicate, and document roadway incidents occurring within MTC’s Express Lanes Roadway Network
Coordinate with operations partners / stakeholders on incident response, including opening or closing the express lane to traffic.
Identify, communicate, and document Toll Collection System (TCS) roadway hardware and application issues and failures
Monitor toll rates, roadway and traffic conditions, and MTC’s Dynamic Pricing Algorithm using online and system-based tools such as CCTV, proprietary tools and reports, Computer Aided Dispatch, and 511.
Monitor for, investigate, and report issues related to the TCS trip building, image processing, and toll rate assignment.
Perform manual toll rate overrides based on current traffic conditions and per SOPs.
Coordinate with MTC and the Toll System Integrator (TSI) to resolve equipment and system issues
Coordinate with MTC, the TSI, and consultants to respond to inquiries from other agencies or the public.
Prepare reports (e.g., end of shift, daily, weekly, monthly).
Perform system functions testing and evidence package review following TCS build deployments and other modifications to the system
Support emergency operations, including after-hours support of High Profile incidents.
Maintain skills proficiency in Express Lanes operations.
Maintain skills proficiency in MTC 511 operations adequately to support augmentation needs.
Participate in training needed for existing and new systems as they come online.
What you need to be successful in this role:
High School Graduate or General Education Degree (GED): Required
Minimum six (6) months experience in client service/relations environment.
Other Requirements:
Excellent verbal communication skills over phone and in person
Minimum six (6) months experience in client service/relations environment.
Ability to work in a fast-paced work environment
Ability to take direction and follow detailed procedures
Excellent attention to detail
Punctual and reliable schedule adherence

Title: Litigation Associate
Location:
San Francisco, CA 94104 
(Financial District/South Beach area)
Description:
We are Renne Public Law Group (“RPLG”), named by the Daily Journal as one of the Top 20 Boutique Law Firms in California. Two of our partners are Daily Journal Top 100 Women Lawyers in California, and other partners are California Super Lawyers.
We are looking for litigators with demonstrated academic success, and two to three years’ experience working on all aspects of litigation including written discovery, depositions, motion practice and trial work, to join our growing practice in the federal and state courts throughout California. Experience in labor and employment law, public sector law and appeals is a plus.
Our firm was founded by Louise Renne, former San Francisco City Attorney, a pioneer of affirmative litigation in the public interest. Our lawyers have decades of experience litigating innovative cases. We practice public law, in the public interest, representing public agencies all over the state in court, arbitrations and before administrative agencies including the Public Employment Relations Board.
If you join us, you can expect to take on major case responsibility including direct client contact, investigations, depositions, court and administrative hearings and trial. A Senior Associate who joined us in 2019 had three trials in his first year. In the coming year, we have an exciting line up of cases. We are looking for an associate who can hit the ground running and who will take ownership of assignments to move matters forward.
Our cases often present thorny and novel legal issues. Many involve challenging questions of state and federal constitutional and statutory law. Below is a sample of matters:
On behalf of a county, we recently defended an industry challenge to a citizen initiative that presented questions of void for vagueness, federal preemption and other issues.
On behalf of a hospital dedicated to care for the indigent, we are suing a retirement system for systematically overcharging to the detriment of the hospital’s mission in violation of state constitutional duties.
On behalf of a public skilled nursing facility, we defended claims in state court of whistleblower retaliation arising out of the facility’s efforts to improve services to its residents and obtained a complete defense verdict.
On behalf of various public entities, we are litigating cutting edge issues regarding application of the state and federal contracts clauses, including a case pending in the California Supreme Court.
We have joined with other attorneys to sue opioid manufacturers and large technology companies over their corporate practices.
RPLG is an equal opportunity employer. We value a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture. RPLG encourages applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Black people, Indigenous people, people of color; lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and intersex people; women; people with disabilities, and protected veterans are all strongly encouraged to apply.
RPLG makes every effort to assure that its recruitment and employment provide all qualified persons, including persons with disabilities, with full opportunities for employment in all positions.
RPLG is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability and need assistance applying online, please email resumes@publiclawgroup.com. If you are selected for an interview, you will receive additional information regarding how to request an accommodation for the interview process.
Compensation is based on experience. The position will remain open until filled. All applications will be treated confidentially.
If our practice is of interest, we would like to hear from you. Applicants should submit a cover letter describing their education, career goals, and relevant experience, along with their resume, and a writing sample.

Title: Laundry Pickup and Delivery Driver
Description:
Apply now through the following link: https://www.rinse.com/valet-landing?utm_source=indeed&utm_content=I-0000-SF-IND-00-44783-J
Easily retrieve deliveries from Rinse facilities. No restaurants, and no riders to deal with!
Why drive with Rinse:
Predictable delivery shifts between 7:00pm 10:30pm, scheduled according to your availability.
Earn up to $40/hr.
Keep 100% of tips.
Guaranteed hourly minimum (varies by market).
Driving expenses are reimbursed at $0.625/mile driven. Because you're a W-2 employee of Rinse, we add a mileage reimbursement ($0.625/mile) to your paycheck to account for gas and wear and tear to your vehicle. So, if your vehicle uses 28 MPG and you drive approximately 20 miles for Rinse, you'd spend $4.06 on gas for your route but reimbursed $12.50! Data usage is also reimbursed!
W2 employee benefits: payroll taxes covered, up to 72 hours of Paid Sick Leave, and other benefits such as company credits for laundry and dry cleaning services and mobile data reimbursement.
Career advancement opportunities: many of our managers started out delivering as Valets.
Driving for Rinse is perfect for…
Those looking for seasonal work, temporary work, part-time work, and those looking for a supplemental income.
Those looking to work in the evening.
Those with or without previous experience as a transportation driver, truck driver, taxi driver, courier driver or delivery driver. We welcome those who have driven with other peer-to-peer ridesharing networks such as Lyft, Uber, Munchery, Postmates, Caviar, Instacart, Shyp, Luxe, Zirx. Our delivery valets come from all backgrounds and industries ranging from traditional driving and transportation industries to more customer service and creative industries.
As the ideal candidate, you need…
Friendly personality
4-door vehicle
Clean driving record
Smartphone w/ GPS
Availability to work 7:00pm-10:30pm pm shifts
Ability to carry up to 40 lb bags for 3.5 hour shifts (IMPORTANT)
Must be available to work Saturday and Sunday
About Rinse
Rinse is building the first and largest national, and eventually global, brand in clothing care. We're taking on a massive consumer problem and creating a significantly better dry cleaning and laundry experience through the combination of "smart scheduling" and best-in-class quality, all supported by a strong technology backbone.
We launched in 2013 and are currently in San Francisco, Los Angeles, Washington, D.C., Chicago, and Boston, with plans to launch multiple new markets in 2023. We've grown at double digit month-over-month rates since launch, have created a differentiated service our customers love, and have a model where the economics actually work.
Rinse is backed by a group of leading VCs and CEOs who see the massive potential in what we are doing and know we are the team to do it. We are looking for stars to join our team and can’t wait to hear from you.

Title: Veterinary Technician
Description:
Are you a people person who possesses and believes in willingness, commitment, and readiness to take action? If you enjoy working in an environment where you get to make an impact on people’s lives then we want you at San Bruno Pet Hospital.
Overview:
We are seeking a dedicated and compassionate Veterinary Assistant or Veterinary Technician to join our team. As a Veterinary Assistant/Technician, you will play a crucial role in providing high-quality care to our animal patients. Your expertise and skills will contribute to the overall well-being of the animals under our care.
Duties:
- Assist veterinarians in providing medical care to animals
- Perform various diagnostic tests and procedures under the supervision of a veterinarian
- Administer medications, vaccines, and treatments as prescribed by the veterinarian
- Monitor and record vital signs of animals during procedures and treatments
- Prepare animals for surgery and assist during surgical procedures
- Perform dental cleanings and assist with dental procedures
- Collect and analyze laboratory samples
- Provide assistance with radiographs and other imaging procedures
- Maintain accurate medical records for each animal patient
Skills:
- Strong knowledge of animal physiology and veterinary medicine
- Proficient in veterinary critical care techniques
- Skilled in animal catheterization and venipuncture
- Excellent pet care skills, including handling and restraint techniques
- Knowledge of laboratory procedures and ability to perform basic lab tests
- Experience in canine and feline handling
- Familiarity with animal husbandry practices
Requirements:
- High school diploma or equivalent required; completion of a veterinary technician program preferred
- Certification as a Veterinary Technician is a plus
- Previous experience working in a veterinary clinic or hospital is required
- Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
- Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment while maintaining attention to detail
We are looking for a great veterinary technician who is skilled with animals AND people. Being an Animal Nurse/Vet Tech isn't for everyone, but if you have the skills built by experience please contact us.
We work hard, laugh a lot, have regular team building meetings and are dedicated to the best possible care for our patients and clients. Our salaries are competitive. We offer health insurance, dental & vision insurance, bonuses, 401K, employee discounts, paid vacation, and CE benefits. If you are energetic, outgoing, enjoy educating clients and using your skills with radiology, dentistry, laboratory, patient care, and anesthesiology-- then you are the person we are looking for!
You will also be successful in this position if you possess the following attributes:
Ability to multi-task and handle a strong patient load
Are collaborative, detail-oriented and compassionate
Enjoy working in a fun and supportive environment with a team of happy individuals who love their jobs
Please send references with your resume and original cover letter. Also please include if you have bilingual skills.
https://www.facebook.com/SanBrunoPet/

Silicon Valley Logistics (SVL) is one of Amazon’s newest delivery service partners in the Bay Area. We’re looking for smart, energetic, and hard-working associates for full-time, part-time, and peak-time roles delivering Amazon packages.

Title: Nanny/Babysitter
Description:
About us
Call Emmy, Inc. is a double-sided marketplace that provides much-needed on-demand help to time-starved parents. We provide help in childcare, companion care, cleaning, chores, party help, and more. Our bookers request their booking on our app or website, and our service providers (we lovingly call them Fairies), pick the booking that works with their schedule or need. There is no minimum number of bookings per Fairy, and there is no maximum. You take what you like with just a click of a button. Easy peasy!
Seeking nanny/babysitters/home managers to care for child/ren in private homes or events.
We are seeking nurturing, responsible, and loving individuals with prior experience caring for children as huge pluses (but not required). Nanny/Babysitter must be comfortable with all activities related to childcare (preferred, but not required: cooking) and have a background in providing after-school care on a regular basis to elementary-aged children. We offer flexible hours (this is a gig platform, so you take what you like as well as an awesome range of gigs (from chores to childcare and more).
Also, we are seeing a huge demand in on-site care for events, conferences and churches. These are large holiday parties, professional conferences and mega churches and are the most popular gigs on our platform. Once you are on our platform and have taken a few private gigs, you can qualify to be a care provider for these elite events.
You must be 18 or older, apply on our website and pass a background check. When you apply, please give it 20 minutes preferably in front of a computer.

Title: Move Team Employee
Description:
Description
Starting pay in SFO of $23.72 per hour with competitive benefits that let you see the world:
There’s never been a more exciting time to join United Airlines. We’re on a path towards becoming the best airline in the history of aviation. Our shared purpose – Connecting People, Uniting the World – is about more than getting people from one place to another. It also means that as a global company that operates in hundreds of locations around the world with millions of customers and tens of thousands of employees, we have a unique responsibility to uplift and provide opportunities in the places where we work, live and fly, and we can only do that with a truly diverse and inclusive workforce. Our careers include competitive benefits package aimed at keeping you happy, healthy and well-traveled. From world-class benefits like 401k and space available travel privileges, United is truly a one-of-a-kind place to work. Are you ready to travel the world?
Travel: Fly United for free - domestic and international – bring your friends and family too!
Flexibility: Opportunities for overtime and ability to trade shifts to work a flexible schedule.
Phenomenal Benefits: 401(k), pension plan, health insurance and an Employee Assistance Plan for you and your family.
Build your career: Opportunity to learn and grow into leadership roles with over half of our leaders starting in the operation.
Up to $23.72/ hour: Seniority-based pay raises with additional compensation for shift differential and overtime.
As the face of our customer, here’s what you will do:
Whether our customers are traveling for business or pleasure, you are the professional in the airport that crafts important connections and encourages an environment where everyone feels welcome, valued, and respected. You will be interacting with our domestic and international customers in our lobbies and at gates, helping them with ticketing, baggage, greeting customers as they start and end their journey and doing it with a smile. You will provide friendly, professional, confident, and insightful service to help resolve customer travel issues and make their experience memorable.
Key Responsibilities:
A Move Team Employee is a Specialty position within the Ramp Service classification that exists in designated locations allocated and authorized by United to perform work related to the movement of aircraft. A Move Team Employee must successfully complete the required training program, including annual recurrent training and testing, consisting of both United and Airport required training. Other responsibilities may include, but not limited to:
Responsible for Aircraft Tows and maintenance pushback for United Airlines and Alliances
Responsible for Movement of aircraft on taxiway with highspeed tug
Coordinates movement of aircraft from remote locations to terminals, and from the terminals to remote parking areas
Communicates with Operations Center and Aircraft Maintenance on all movements
Support remotely parked aircraft with proper Ground Service Equipment (GSE), such as stairs, ground power units and air conditioning or heat carts
Support the Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) shutdown team
Constant communication with ramp tower and Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) tower while operating on live taxiway
Maintain and service all tow ground equipment
United values diverse experiences, perspectives, and we encourage everyone who meets the minimum qualifications to apply. While having the “desired” qualifications make for a stronger candidate, we encourage applicants who may not feel they check ALL of those boxes! We are always looking for individuals who will bring something new to the table!
Qualifications
What’s needed to succeed (Minimum Qualifications):
1+ years ramp service experience
Aircraft pushback experience
Must have a High School Diploma/GED (General Equivalency Development) or equivalent
Must be proficient in communicating in English at an FAA operational level
Must have the ability to stand, bend, stoop, and crawl for extended periods of time and lift passenger baggage repeatedly
Must be able to work in a fast paced, deadline driven environment
Must be able to tolerate working in an outdoor environment with high noise levels and climate/weather conditions
Must be able to successfully pass all pre-employment clearances
Must be eligible to acquire and maintain credentials necessary for the position
Must be flexible to work ANY shift in a 24/7 operation which can include nights, weekends and holidays (schedules are dictated by seniority according to Union contract guidelines)
Must possess a valid STATE Driver's License (Suspended, expired, revoked or denied are not considered valid)
Must be willing to adhere to United's dress code
Successfully pass all required training and airport required movement area testing
What will help you propel from the pack (Preferred Qualifications):
Previous outdoor and/or heavy lifting job experience and safety awareness preferred
Previous Hub experience

Title: Nanny/Babysitter
Description:
Job Overview: Become a “Nurturing Nanny” at Nurny!
At Nurny we are looking for energetic and caring individuals to supervise children/adolescents with neurodevelopmental diagnoses (i.e., autism, ADHD, Down syndrome, global developmental delay, etc etc.). We are seeking caring and experienced professionals who enjoy spending time with kids and helping them lead more independent lives. The successful applicant will be responsible for engaging children in fun, developmentally appropriate activities, following through with therapeutic interventions and utilizing individualized communication strategies.
The successful applicant must have availability Monday - Thursday 1:30pm - 8:00pm. Additionally, the applicant should be able to commute to/from San Francisco and have at least 1 year experience working with children with neurodevelopmental needs.
This wonderful family is looking for a caregiver for their 12-year-old daughter to provide support and structure afterschool. Role could increase to 30+ hours weekly for qualified caregivers who would prefer to work more hours/weekends. Pay will scale per experience.
Their daughter is an adventurous and curious pre-teen whose disability affects her gross/fine motor skills and speech. Please note that she also has a seizure condition, so caregivers working with her must have experience working with similar needs. The most important thing is to be open-minded with a positive attitude.
Family would also appreciate help on the weekends, and could add weekday hours or split shifts between two people if only partial availability is possible.
Responsibilities and Duties
● Facilitate communication using individualized communication systems
● Assist in the generalization of therapeutic interventions, if applicable
● Engage children in fun and developmentally appropriate activities
● Assist children with school tasks and/or assignments, if applicable
● Utilize positive behavior strategies to support emotional well-being during periods of behavior escalation
● Assist with toileting and other self care activities when necessary
Requirements/Qualifications
● At least 1 year experience working with individuals with neurodevelopmental diagnoses or developmental disabilities (i.e., autism, ADHD, Down syndrome, global developmental delay, etc)
● High School Diploma/GED
● Previous nannying experience
● Must have reliable transportation to get to and from client's home
have current automobile insurance
● Be able to lift up 50lbs, walk continuously for a consecutive 10 minutes
Preferred Qualifications:
At least 1 year enrolled in college/university with major/minor in related field
At least 1 year working in a 1:1 capacity with high needs individuals or those with neurodevelopmental diagnoses (i.e., autism, ADHD, Down syndrome, global developmental delay, etc
At least 1 year work with children/adolescents in home environment
Willingness to pick up from school or other community settings

Flexible schedule

Title: Operations Associate
Location: Hybrid work in San Francisco, CA 94102
Description:
The Position:
50+1 Strategies is looking for an energetic and highly organized Operations Associate to join our team thru the end of the 2024 election cycle. This is an entry/mid-level position, working out of our San Francisco headquarters. The position is expected to commence no later than June 10th, and is initially set through December 31st, 2024, with the potential of transitioning to a permanent role based on future organizational needs.
Your primary responsibility is to work with our Chief Operating Officer to oversee and manage the company’s finances and provide administrative support for the company’s internal operations. The Operations Associate will also work closely with other team members and departments to ensure smooth operations of client programs and internal projects.
This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is a self-starter, and enjoys the dynamic environment of a small but growing company with multiple responsibilities and room to grow.
Who We Are:
50+1 Strategies is a California-based political consulting and civic engagement firm. We operate at the local, state, and national levels to elect Democratic leaders into public office, advance important issues at the ballot box, and support causes that create positive change. We offer a full suite of in-house capabilities under one roof - from grassroots organizing, public relations strategy, online advocacy, advertising, and media buying, creative content production, research and analysis, messaging and communications, and much much more.
Our team is made up of diverse professionals who have demonstrated success in the public, private, and nonprofit sectors. We pride ourselves on being a full-service civic engagement firm that brings heart and hustle to everything we do. We aim to build issue-based movements and electoral campaigns that reflect the communities around them, empower and strengthen volunteer leadership, and engage people in a meaningful way.
For more information, please visit our website: www.50p1.com.
Principal Duties:
Supporting 50+1 Strategies day-to-day operations by maintaining accurate books, managing accounts payables and receivables, tracking billable expenses, and recording financial data, ensuring timely and accurate outputs.
Compiling and maintaining business data and metrics necessary to effectively monitor business performance across all of our service offerings, including project budgets, cashflow, profit and losses, and staffing analysis.
Performing monthly invoicing by gathering and compiling data, coordinating with other departments on cost allocations, and working with outside accountants to record information in the accounting system.
Manage the company’s vendor relationships, technology platforms, subscriptions, and physical offices
Working with the Chief Operating Officer to develop and maintain mission-critical systems to support management decisions. Analyzing existing financial and accounting processes and making recommendations for improvements.
It is anticipated that the principal duties of the position will include those listed above, but a successful candidate will have the willingness and capacity to take on different tasks to respond to emerging needs.
Who you are:
You are passionate about promoting progressive campaigns and causes, but prefer to focus on the practical aspects of the work. Your approach to life and work is thorough and meticulous, favoring a technical approach to ideas and challenges. You have a reliable and steady nature, but you are also flexible and willing to embrace different responsibilities as the situation requires.
Preferred Skills / Qualifications:
Enthusiasm for 50+1 Strategies’ work and purpose.
Genuine interest in working with numbers, data, systems and processes.
Proficiency with spreadsheet applications - pivot tables, uploading/downloading/analyzing data from external sources.
Some experience or familiarity with Quickbooks or related accounting software.
A diligent self-starter, with high attention to detail, willingness to learn, and the ability to anticipate organizational needs.
Excellent organizational skills to manage multiple priorities and efficiently perform various duties for different business functions in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.
Strong work ethic and commitment to process and seeing things through to the end.
Location: San Francisco, CA
This position is full-time and will be based out of our San Francisco headquarters, but will have the flexibility to work remotely from home 2-3 days a week.
Compensation:
Monthly compensation commensurate with experience, with entry-level starting at $70,000/year (annualized). 50+1 Strategies provides comprehensive healthcare and dental benefits, 401K plan, generous vacation and flexible working arrangements, and professional development stipends.
Application Instructions:
Please apply online on our website: https://50p1.com/jobs/. (Do not submit on Indeed) Applications will be accepted until May 10, 2024 at 5PM PST.
Equal Opportunity Employment:
50+1 Strategies, LLC is an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to hiring a diverse workforce and we value our inclusive culture. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals from all races, religions, gender identities, sexual orientations, age, national origins, and marital/veteran/disability statuses.

Title: Clinical Director for Residential Programs
Description:
Title: Clinical Director for Residential Programs
Reports to: Deputy Director of Residential Programs

Location: Across STP Housing sites in SF
Work schedule: M-F 8 a.m.-4 p.m.
Salary: $125,000 - $135,000

Summary: With the direction and support of the Deputy Director of Residential Programs and Director of Property Management, the Clinical Director for Residential Programs is responsible for oversight of the clinical aspects of Swords to Plowshares’ residential programs. Duties of this position include clinical supervision of residential programs clinical staff, assuring the proper functioning of the program, and the safety and well-being of the program participants. These programs serve veterans with disabilities experiencing and exiting homelessness. Duties of this position include supervision of staff, oversight of clinical programs, quality review, and the safety and well-being of veterans living in Swords to Plowshares properties. Programs include the following:
Swords to Plowshares houses over 500 veterans across 6 housing sites. At our sites, we offer a range of services including low-barrier and low-demand stabilization housing beds, Safe Haven, in addition to supportive services for veterans in permanent housing. The Transitional housing and contract program focuses on securing permanent housing while addressing substance abuse, mental health and other barriers that could impact a veteran's ability to live independently. Supportive Services in permanent settings focus on providing clinical support and case management for veterans who have secured permanent supportive housing emphasizing housing retention. We also operate the Veteran Support to Self-Reliance pilot program across all our permanent sites: this pilot program offers enhanced services to veterans who are aging and live with a disabling condition.
Roles and Responsibilities
The clinical function includes: direct supervision of counseling staff, case conference facilitation, oversight of treatment planning, oversight of staff charting and documentation, staff training, client assessment and referral, assignment of client caseloads, crisis intervention, census management, liaison to referring clinicians, and acting as clinical resource to staff of agency housing sites. The coordination of treatment with other providers, especially the VA, and the liaison work that is required, are also essential responsibilities. This involves supporting staff in their communication with VA staff.
As a member of the agency director-level staff, provides input to other directors on matters of expertise and experience. Provides input to Chief Operating Officer and Executive Director on clinical issues impacting veteran clients and residents.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES include but may are not limited to:
Supervision of assigned staff
Oversight of chart review at all sites (shared with Clinical Director)
Timecard approvals
Case conference facilitation
Oversight of treatment planning
Staff training
Census management
Client assessment and referral overview
Overview of assignment of client caseloads
Crisis intervention
Liaison to referring clinicians, and serving as clinical resource, including coordination of treatment with other providers, especially the VA, and the liaison work that is required to accomplish this. This also involves supporting staff in their communication with VA staff
The Clinical Director for Residential Programs will also contribute to housing efforts which might include for provisions of services and attending community meetings
The Clinical Director for Residential Programs will also share on-call after hours’ coverage for the Safe Haven program. Will also share on-call duties with Assistant Clinical Director for Residential Programs for emergencies
Internal compliance management for the various grants to include but not limited to the Veterans Administration and Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing
Requirements:
Minimum of 5 years experience providing counseling and other services to disadvantaged or otherwise “hard to serve” clients.
Minimum of 5 years experience in multi-disciplinary treatment planning, individual and group psychotherapy, substance abuse counseling and crisis intervention.
Minimum of a Masters degree in Counseling, Social Work or related field.
License required (MFT, LCSW, LPCC).
Minimum of 2 years experience providing clinical supervision to associates registered with the CA BBS (ASW, AMFT, APCC)
Training in the use of DSM V-TR in order to develop provisional diagnosis.
Training and familiarity with treatment protocols in Substance abuse, PTSD, Major Depression, Anxiety Disorders and Schizophrenia.
Must be able to communicate effectively with a variety of personalities and be comfortable working with an at-risk client population, including embracing the agency’s Diversity Equity and Inclusion policy.
A thorough understanding of the problems faced by veterans from all eras to include a specific emphasis on homelessness, substance abuse/dependence, and post-traumatic stress and adjustment disorders.
Excellent interpersonal and supervisory skills, including conflict resolution, crisis intervention, quality assurance, staff development, and performance appraisal.
Effective time management skills
Analytical and organizational ability. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to use general office software such as word processing, email and preparation of spreadsheets.
Valid Driver’s License
Travel between sites is required (mileage reimbursed).
Employees must be able to carry out the essential duties of the position within what can be considered reasonable accommodation.
Supervisory Responsibilities
The Clinical Director will directly supervise up to 6 staff across our housing portfolio
Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Statement of Intent: Swords to Plowshares is fully committed to the ongoing work of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive organization. For us, this is a process and not a destination. We embrace the principles of cultural humility to create spaces where all people feel welcome, heard, and valued. We stand against injustice and discrimination of all kinds. This includes mistreatment based on race, age, color, veteran/military status, language, ethnic background, national origin, ancestry, ability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression, other status protected by law, and the other qualities/traits that make you unique. We encourage applications from all

Title: Dental Director (Part-time)
Description:
Job Description
Title of Position: Dental Director
Job Summary: Clinic by the Bay has an exciting opportunity for a dentist to help us develop and implement a dental program for Clinic by the Bay. We will be re-locating to a larger space (still in the Excelsior District) in the next year or so that will enable us to offer free dental services for our patient population of the working poor.
We need a dynamic, committed dentist to help us design the dental clinic and provide at least part-time supervision of the dental program/hygienists. As our primary concern is locating the right person, you will have significant input as to the initial set up and operations of the dental clinic. We are flexible in terms of FTE/time commitment and schedule—within reason and to still provide benefit to our patient community. The Dental Director provides clinical leadership, oversight, quality assurance, and support to all volunteer dental providers.
Reports to: Executive Director
Location: San Francisco, Excelsior District (close to MUNI and BART)
Duties and Responsibilities:
Guide the overall concept and direction of dental clinic programs in collaboration with the Executive Director, Medical Director, Dental Assistant, and team members.
Work closely with the Executive Director, Medical Director, Board, and Staff to develop and implement dental clinic services and protocols, secure partnerships and equipment, and more.
Recruits and supervises volunteer providers (dentists, hygienists) to deliver quality dental care.
Ensure that all dental staff and volunteers are properly screened, credentialed, oriented and supervised.
Serve as lead contact with dental specialists and specialty services.
Serve as spokesperson for Clinic by the Bay on all dental matters. Conduct presentations, host tours, and attend community functions with the Executive Director and Board members as needed.
Ensure that all state, federal, local, OSHA, CLIA, and other regulatory guidelines are adhered to and that staff is trained in all proper procedures.
Promote, establish and maintain open and effective communication with all team members to improve relations, solve problems, and access resources.
Provide dental/clinical duties of direct patient care, when appropriate.
QUALIFICATIONS:
DDS or DMD Degree – Minimum 3 years experience as a practicing dentist.
Demonstrated leadership experience.
Genuine passion in caring for the underserved; commitment to the mission and values of Volunteers in Medicine and Clinic by the Bay.
Highly developed interpersonal skills and ability to effectively work with paid staff and volunteers.
Ability to supervise and coach other providers and work cooperatively with paid staff and volunteers.
Computer skills and familiarity with EHR systems.
Bilingual Spanish preferred.
About Clinic by the Bay: Clinic by the Bay (www.clinicbythebay.org) is a free, volunteer-powered health care clinic in San Francisco. Located in the Excelsior neighborhood, the clinic is based on the successful national model, Volunteers in Medicine (www.volunteersinmedicine.org), that engages retired and practicing doctors, nurses and non-medical volunteers to provide compassionate care, free-of-charge, to the working uninsured. Our mission is to understand and serve, with dignity and respect, the health and wellness needs of the medically underserved in the San Francisco Bay Area.

Title: Administrative Assistant
Location:
San Francisco, CA 94103 
(South of Market area)
Description:
Position Overview
Presidio Knolls School seeks an Administrative Assistant with excellent organization skills. The successful candidate will be responsible, able to be self-directed to manage and meet the needs of a busy, growing PreK – 8 independent school. The position reports to the Director of Operations & HR and will support the Business Office other administration staff as needed. The position is non-exempt and full-time with scheduled hours from 9:00am – 6:00pm year-round. The opening is for an immediate start.
Essential Functions
Performs administrative assignments with minimal direction and serves as key administrator for the school.
Professionally greets and assists staff, students and visitors, answers questions for staff, parents, students, and others.
Assists with document preparation/staff and parent communication as needed.
Maintains an adequate supply of office supplies and materials for the administrative office area.
Tracks student lunch orders and distributes.
Maintains spreadsheet to track school order processing and receiving of approved purchase requests from teachers and administrative staff.
Coordinates and schedules meetings, meeting rooms and required equipment for meetings.
Coordinates field trips with Division Heads and faculty.
Coordinates travel arrangements for teachers and administrative staff.
Operates a variety of office equipment including computers, printers etc.
Supports preparation and set up for school events.
Supports administrative leadership team with meeting scheduling.
Is a key point person to help with students who have been injured or are feeling unwell, by assisting with basic medical care, following up with parents, and directly supervising the student until they are picked up.
Contacts parents and keeps track of all attendance records on a daily basis – database knowledge helpful.
Maintains school and student files as needed to meet regulatory and compliance requirements.
Contributes positively to employee morale; maintains a positive, pleasant demeanor to all constituencies.
Performs other duties as directed.
Qualifications
High school diploma or GED and a minimum of six months previous experience in an equivalent position or equivalent amount of relevant training and experience.
Ability to multitask, prioritize and provide feedback and follow through.
Experience working in a school and/or with children preferred.
Excellent communication skills.
Ability to apply common sense understanding and to carry out written and oral instructions.
Ability to respond in an emergency and communicate with appropriate staff and/or emergency personnel.
Competency with internet, email, databases, word processing, spreadsheet applications and ability to learn other platforms as needed.
Ability to use and maintain printer/copier and other office equipment.
Fluency in speaking, reading, writing in Mandarin highly desired.
Physical Requirements and Work Environment
Regularly sit, talk, hear and visually intercept visitors.
Be able to occasionally lift and move up to 45 lbs.
Work at a desk and computer screen for extended periods of time.
Turn, bend, reach and occasionally use a ladder.
Work in a busy, often distracting environment.
Please apply if you. . .
Have a passion and interest in elementary teaching
Enjoy contributing to student and community life inside and outside the classroom. PKS is a community, and our close relationships build a solid foundation for our kids.
Work towards social justice and support multicultural education. As a progressive school, we are growing engaged global citizens equipped with empathy, compassion and practices that position them to thrive in a diverse society.
Love collaboration, iteration, and innovation.
Enjoy guiding and supporting students as they grow.
Are ready to roll up your sleeves and join a team that will do whatever it takes to support students as they learn, grow, and thrive.
Compensation
PKS offers a competitive compensation package commensurate with qualifications and experience:
Pay range is from $29.00 - $33.00 per hour.
Health, dental and vision fully covered for the employee.
403b match
Wellness Program
Employee Assistance Program
Commuting support of up to $55 per month.
16 paid holidays per year
Vacation accrual of 15 days per year
Presidio Knolls School offers equal opportunity to all, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, and national origin, ethnicity, age, sex or disability or other protected class status under any applicable laws. Employment will be contingent on successful completion of a background check.

About Presidio Knolls School
PKS was founded on the idea that a progressive educational model can be combined with rigorous Mandarin immersion to create a vibrant, innovative school where children will thrive in a joyful environment. Since 2008, we have grown rapidly and established a unique position in the Bay Area’s independent school community. As of the spring 2024, the school enrolls nearly 400 students in Preschool through Grade 8.

The progressive philosophy of Presidio Knolls School embraces kids as co-collaborators in their education, valuing their voice and agency to shape their own learning journey. The school has a commitment to social-emotional learning that permeates the culture of the school.

Title: Autonomous Vehicle Tester for Quality Control (Driving Position)
Description:
Are you passionate about innovative technology and the future of autonomous transportation? If the thrill of being at the cutting edge of automotive technology excites you, this opportunity is your calling! We're in search of a dedicated and safety-conscious professional to join our team as a Level 3 Vehicle Operator at an on-demand, autonomous ride-hailing company.
This role places you at the heart of our mission, where you'll not only ensure the safety and readiness of our vehicles but also be involved in critical testing and representation of our client's brand. It's an unparalleled opportunity to be part of a team driving forward the realization of autonomous mobility, offering hands-on experience in vehicle and personnel operations.
*
Core Attributes & What You Bring to The Table*
Your success in this role is defined by your:
Safety-First Attitude – You prioritize safety above everything else, always adhering to protocols and standards.
Team Collaboration – Your ability to work harmoniously with various teams showcases your commitment to our collective goal.
Adaptability – You're flexible and prepared to take on diverse roles to support the mission, showing resilience and readiness to learn.
Communication Excellence – Providing clear, accurate feedback to our engineering teams is second nature to you, enhancing our development and operations.
Reliability – Your discipline and work ethic make you a dependable member of the team, contributing to our success and innovation.
*
Responsibilities & Daily Expectations*
Your position is multifaceted, primarily focusing on ensuring the advancement and reliability of our autonomous vehicle operations. Your responsibilities will be centered around software testing and quality control to enhance our engineering initiatives. Daily activities include:
Supporting software testing efforts to ensure the functionality and safety of autonomous vehicles.
Documenting test results and operational issues to aid in software improvement and development.
Collaborating on team projects, both internally and externally, to achieve strategic objectives and operational excellence.
Engaging in vehicle logistics support, emphasizing preventative maintenance and efficient vehicle deployment.
Assisting in the collection of performance data to provide insights that drive engineering enhancements.
*
Requirements & Qualifications for Success*
To excel in contributing to our pioneering efforts in autonomous driving technology, candidates should prioritize software testing and documentation expertise, along with a commitment to operational excellence.
This full-time, ongoing contract role is based in San Francisco, since this is an onsite position applicants must be local. The essential qualifications include:
A strong background in documentation and quality control.
Ability to spend extended periods of time in a vehicle and working on a task.
Excellent communication skills and a methodical, inventive approach to problem-solving.
A valid driver’s license held for at least the last three years, with a clean driving record.
Flexibility to work shifts during days, nights, and weekends, with extra compensation for non-standard hours.
For those who aim to exceed our minimum requirements, the following qualifications are preferred:
A bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in a technical field related to this role, with a focus on software testing and documentation.
Experience in a structured environment, such as military service, which is highly valued.
Proven ability to work autonomously, navigate technical challenges efficiently, and meet deadlines.
*
About Our Client*
Our client is revolutionizing personal transportation with their vision of making it safer, cleaner, and more enjoyable for everyone. As a pioneer in mobility-as-a-service, they are dedicated to redefining urban transit through their innovative autonomous vehicle technology.
Their commitment extends beyond just transporting people; they handle driving, charging, maintenance, and vehicle updates, offering a seamless experience for riders.
After joining forces with a major online retail company in 2020, they have been accelerating towards launching their first ride-hailing service, aiming to set new standards in the autonomous vehicle industry.
They are on the lookout for dynamic individuals passionate about driving change and contributing to the future of transportation. If you're eager to be part of a team that's building sustainable and cutting-edge mobility solutions, our client is your destination.
*
The Company & Our Commitment to You*
Ami Arroyo Recruiting is more than just a recruiting firm; we're a partner in your career journey. We are dedicated to connecting exceptional talent with meaningful opportunities, supporting the growth of careers and companies alike. We understand that everyone's path is unique, and we're committed to finding the perfect fit for each individual.
If you are a safety-focused, dynamic professional looking for an opportunity that matches your drive and ability, let's connect!
_
We embrace diversity and are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to their status. While we are not able to sponsor visas at this time, we welcome every candidate eligible to work in the United States to connect with us._

Title: Operations Specialist (Human Data Collection)
Description:
HireArt is helping a cutting edge AI research and deployment company hire Operations Specialists (Human Data Collection). In this role, you will be responsible for the effectiveness of the company's human data collection by measuring performance, resolving process and tooling challenges, training AI trainers, and improving data quality and AI training outcomes.

We're looking for candidates with experience managing data labeling operation with a passion for process improvements to help build a system that efficiently teaches AI models how to understand difficult questions and execute complex instructions. You should have excellent communication skills, be highly analytical, and take a hands-on, proactive approach to scoping and forecasting the needs of the program.

As an Operations Specialist (Human Data Collection), you'll:
Work closely with external vendors and internal researchers to collect, review, and deliver high-quality data.
Use internal tooling to assess labeled data and provide feedback to AI trainers.
Think critically and share recommendations on tooling/process improvements, optimizing for quality, throughput and AI trainer experience.
Partner with cross-functional teams to start up new data collection projects by gathering requirements, writing instructions and training the AI trainers.
Experience managing data labeling operations for large scale projects
Experience managing/designing quality systems
Experience working on complex annotation/data collection projects that are text-based or multi-modal
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google Suite (specifically spreadsheets)
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely while anticipating the needs of company vendors/partners
Prior experience teaching/leading with a passion to help others get things done
Enjoy thinking in systems and processes, taking a systematic approach to work
Have an action-oriented and deeply curious mind, often leading you to become a power user of software and tools
Nice to Have Skills:
Ability to write JSON, SQL, and/or Python
Domain expertise in a specific area (e.g. coding, creative writing, law, medicine) or an ability to speak multiple (3+) languages
Benefits:
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Employer (HireArt) Subsidized healthcare benefits
Flexible Spending Account for healthcare-related costs
HireArt covers all costs for short and long term disability and life insurance
401k package
Commitment: This is a full-time, ongoing contract position staffed via HireArt. It is hybrid and open to candidates local to the San Francisco, CA area.

HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas or employ corp-to-corp.

Title: Human Resources Coordinator
Description:
Human Resources Coordinator
Description
Under the direction of the Chief Operating Officer, the Human Resources Coordinator aids with and facilitates the human resource processes at all business locations. This role administers employee health and welfare plans and acts as a liaison between employees and insurance providers. This position resolves benefits-related problems and ensures effective use of plans and positive employee relations. The Human Resources Coordinator makes that certain plans are administered in accordance with Federal and State regulations and that plan provisions are followed. This role provides administrative support to the human resource function as needed, including record keeping, file maintenance, and HRIS entry.
Supervisory Responsibilities
None
Responsibilities
Administer health and welfare plans, including enrollments, changes and terminations. Processes required documents through payroll and insurance providers to ensure accurate record-keeping and proper deductions.
Performs customer service functions by answering employee requests and questions.
Ensures timely completion of e-verify for Forms i-9.
Submits online investigation requests and assists with new-employee background checks.
Reconciles benefit statements.
Conducts audits of payroll, benefits or other HR programs and recommends corrective action.
Assists with processing of terminations.
Assists with recruitment and interview process. Tracks status of candidates and responds with follow-up letters at the end of the recruiting process.
Schedules meetings and interviews as requested by the director of HR.
Makes photocopies, mails, scans, and emails documents; and performs other clerical functions.
Files documents into appropriate employee files.
Assists or prepares correspondence as requested.
Prepares new-employee files.
Processes mail.
Performs other related duties as assigned.

Bachelor’s degree in human resources or related field

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Working understanding of human resources principles, practices and procedures.
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
Ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment.
Proficient with MS Office or related software.

Title: INTEGRATIVE PEDIATRIC PRACTICE LOOKING TO FILL FRONT DESK POSITION
Description:
GetzWell Pediatrics, San Francisco's only integrative and woman-founded and owned pediatric practice, with locations in Noe Valley and the Marina area, is looking to fill one front desk position. We want to hire someone enthusiastic about working and gaining experience in the medical field, in a collaborative and progressive work environment.
Your personality, experience, and skill set:
- Outgoing and friendly – you love meeting people and are comfortable striking up a conversation with someone you have never met.
- Honest and professional – you conduct yourself with integrity. You say what you mean and do what you say.
- Reliable – you are on time and take ownership of your work.
- Eager to learn and curious – you are not afraid to ask questions and want to learn and grow. You are open to feedback so you can learn and improve.
- Strong work ethic – you have a roll up your sleeves attitude, a no job too big or small approach (i.e. you will plunge a toilet if needed) and actively look for things to do when there’s down time.
- Strive to provide top notch customer service – helping others comes naturally to you. In the office you go above and beyond to help a patient with their requests and when you are unable to do so, you find another person or solution because that is what you would expect as a patient.
- Experience in a private practice setting - 3 years required.
- Experience using healthcare management platforms.
- Excellence in oral and written communication.
- Excellence in multi-tasking and time management – you prioritize appropriately and execute tasks efficiently.
- Attention to detail – you proofread your emails and take pride in your work.
- Thorough – you complete your assigned tasks on time and accurately.
- Interest in the medical administration field.
- Reside in San Francisco.
What you will do:
- Confidently answer inquiries about the practice from prospective new members.
- Enthusiastically greet and move patients through office/appointments, as scheduled.
- Ensure client information is accurate, including demographics and payment information.
- Manage scheduling of patient appointments, courtesy reminders and reschedules, as needed.
- Verify out of network insurance benefits and eligibility.
- Obtain external medical reports and compile medical records, as needed.
- Manage main email account with incoming and outgoing client information and requests.
- Collaborate with GetzWell MDs/Nurse Practitioners for medical advice as pertains to patient/parent inquiries.
- Ensure reception area, exam rooms and all general areas are well maintained, neat and clean.
- Work an alternating schedule between our two offices and some Saturdays.

Title: Every Day Connect Service Coordinator
Description:
Project Homeless Connect (PHC) seeks a creative, dedicated, innovative, and energetic Every Day Connect (EDC) Service Coordinator. You’ll join a San Francisco Legacy Project rooted in community services and committed to serving the homeless and those at risk of homelessness. This is an excellent opportunity for a strong applicant who is accountable, dependable, adaptable, client-centered, and able to work collaboratively with social service team members. We are interested in a candidate committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.
The Service Coordinator position is responsible for coordinating all Every Day Connect (EDC) programs and supporting a primary role within at least one core senses program (Vision, Hearing, and Dental). This position is part of the Every Day Connect (EDC) program, including Drop-In SCs, Off-Site SCs, and Core Senses. The Service Coordinator supports participants and refers them to various homeless resources in the community, including other NPOs and local community Providers, such as the Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing (HSH) Coordinated Entry System, HSH Homeless Outreach Team (SF HOT), and or 311. The Service Coordinator has demonstrated skills, abilities, and qualities commensurate with specific position requirements.
PHC is committed to providing quality community services to San Franciscans experiencing “Homelessness.” While remaining resourceful, we strive to break the cycles of poverty through the delivery of services. It’s an exciting time as we continue expanding our team and supportive services and models.

Title: Entry Level - Wealth Management Associate
Location: Hybrid work in San Francisco, CA 94104
Description:
Job title options: Financial Professional, Wealth Management Associate, Retirement Planning Associate, Financial Consultant
Why become a financial professional?
Pursue what’s possible.
Becoming a financial professional allows you to make a difference in the lives of others by helping clients achieve their financial goals.
Together we guide clients forward with courage and wisdom- supporting them in making the choices that help them lead a fulfilled life- with our financial professionals as the cornerstone of our success.
As a financial professional you can achieve:
Impact: The work you do not only helps clients make smarter decisions in their financial lives, it helps them focus on the people and passion in their lives that matter the most to them
Independence: You control your own career. You move as fast as you like, not as fast as you’re told.
Income: Growing your income is based on one factor: you. You have the ability to accelerate your earning potential. l.
Why us? What makes a good fit?
Our financial professionals are the cornerstones of our
We are on a mission to help people build fulfilling success and we work hard to help them grow their futures. To assist us in this goal, we are looking for businesses by someone who:
Is ambitious and results-driven
Possess a desire to help others competitive products in the financial industry
A team-oriented focus
Has high integrity and professionalism
There’s a lot to be gained from aligning yourself with an organization that enables you to be in business for yourself, but not by yourself. In an increasingly complex industry with constant change, the need for financial professionals is ever-growing and the opportunity is immense.
Equitable Advisors - Job Description
With Equitable founded in 1859, Equitable Advisors is a leading firm in the financial services and insurance industry with a mission to help people build fulfilling futures grounded in our stability, innovative solutions and commitments to our clients.
Equitable Advisors is seeking entrepreneurial-oriented individuals to join our team as a Financial Professional. In that role, you will:
· Analyze financial information obtained from clients to determine strategies, financial products and services to help clients meet their financial objectives
· Build and maintain a client base, keep client plans up-to-date and acquire new clients on an ongoing basis
· Incorporate Holistic Life Planning and Financial Planning strategies to provide recommendations and sell appropriate financial products and services including life insurance, annuities, and investment options (including both Equitable-manufactured products and other products available through our open-infrastructure platform)
What it takes to be an Equitable Advisors’ Financial Professional
With a wide range of successful financial professionals, prior educational focus and professional background does not necessarily dictate success. We see success with people directly out of college, frustrated professionals looking to begin new career opportunities and those already in the financial services industry seeking a more comprehensive platform. We also seek and develop people of all backgrounds built on our proud history and focus of developing diverse talent and enabling an inclusive work environment.
· A four-year college degree is preferred but not required
· You will be required to attain state life and health licenses, SIE, FINRA Series 7 and 66 exams (other designations a plus)
· Results-driven, highly motivated, self-starter who possesses integrity, a strong work ethic and the desire to help others plan for and protect their financial futures
· Team player who possesses excellent interpersonal skills and communication abilities, with a high degree of self-confidence
· Ability to draw upon past/present experiences and acquaintances to develop markets and sustain long-term relationships
Note -- applicants must be authorized to work in the United States.
Benefits of working with us
· Compensation you control and a complete benefits package
· Personalized and comprehensive training and support in all areas important to building your business
· Sponsorship as well as coaching to obtain the licensing required for hire
· Ability to specialize in numerous areas from being a Certified Financial Planner, to a junior or senior partner in a firm model, to employee and executive benefits and other specialized areas of focus
· Ability to work jointly with senior joint-work partners and to be coached by top performers
· Advancement and management opportunities
· A work-life balance and access to a full suite of remote-work technology solutions
To get started as a Financial Professional, Equitable Advisors will sponsor your pursuit of the licensing requirements, and our training curriculum is designed to provide the skills and tools you need for the opportunity to succeed. Our training program consists of training across numerous areas: client management skills, sales skills, market development, product knowledge, technology systems and core practice management systems.
Testimonials
"After graduating college, I grew a print marketing company that had over 65 employees. In 2012, after 26 years, I sold my company and decided to get back to my passion which was finance. It was a pretty natural transition from where I was with the printing company to building my business with Equitable Advisors. I called on the clients I had built relationships with over the past 26 years and told them about what I was doing now. I love being able to meet with business owners, really understand what they're going through and help offer financial solutions."
-Jim Altebrando, Financial Professional
"Prior to becoming a Financial Professional, I was a teacher. I enjoyed it, but there was a lack of fulfillment and I was looking for something more. What I love most about this career is that it allows me the flexibility to be a mother and a wife to my family first. Secondly, I get such a thrill knowing that I've been able to help someone with their financial future."
-Arrkeenah Willis, Financial Professional
"I always knew I wanted to get into finance so after college, I started interviewing at about a dozen different firms and chose to join Equitable Advisors. Starting out, it was a challenge, but about six months in, I started getting referrals and could really see the value I was bringing to clients. Since then my business has steadily increased."
-Bryan Tessier, District Manager, PACNW
